title: 'Why didn't he have a go?' Pundits bemused by 'negative', 'gun-shy' Joshua
description: Former British heavyweight champion Dillian Whyte says compatriot Anthony Joshua was "gun shy" as he lost his world titles to Oleksandr Usyk.

title: Letter from Africa: The wonders of Somali cuisine and a taste of home
description: Ethiopian and Eritrean food is well known globally, but this is your chance to discover Somali cooking.

title: In love with the Resistance: My mother-in-law's war
description: Researching family history, Rosie Whitehouse uncovered a story of Protestants and Jews uniting against the Nazis in a French town.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'new beginnings'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

title: Climate change: How to measure a shrinking glacier
description: Scientists warn that under the current melting rate even major glaciers are at risk of disappearing.

title: Nuclear weapons: Explained in numbers
description: Reality Check takes a look at the facts and figures behind the world's nuclear weapons

title: Taxi gardens and Egypt's pharaohs on a pencil - stories you may have missed
description: Abandoned taxis being used to grow vegetables and other stories you may have missed this week.

title: Platinum Jubilee medal designed for emergency service staff
description: The medal, to mark the Queen's 70-year reign, will also be given to members of the armed forces.

title: What's going on with Labour's row?
description: Iain Watson looks at the complex situation facing Sir Keir Starmer and his opponents.

title: Birmingham Pride: Thousands enjoy colourful parade through city centre
description: Thousands of people enjoy the colourful procession through the city centre's streets.

title: Lorry driver shortage: Government working on temporary visa scheme

title: China frees Canadians Michael Spavor and Michael Kovrig after Huawei boss released
description: Michael Spavor and Michael Kovrig were released after tech executive Meng Wanzhou was freed in Canada.

title: EVCL Chill: 400 jobs at risk as food firm goes bust
description: The firm says 650 jobs are saved but 400 others are under threat as a chilled food firm goes bust.

title: Germany elections: Merkel backs 'bridge-builder' Laschet as successor
description: The outgoing leader strongly endorses her party's candidate Armin Laschet in an unusually tight poll race.

title: Sgt Matiu Ratana shooting: Memorial services held
description: Sgt Matiu Ratana is remembered across London and Sussex on Saturday, and with a service in November.

title: Sabina Nessa: Book of condolence opened for killed teacher
description: It is set up near to where the teacher was found dead as police continue to hunt a man seen on CCTV.

title: Labour conference: Sir Keir Starmer drops rule-change plan
description: Proposals to reform the party's leadership elections faced huge opposition from the left of the party.

title: Tamworth Snow Dome: Boy, 12, dies after injury during activity

description: Deputy party leader Angela Rayner will open Labour's conference with the party's offer to workers.

title: 200-year-old palm comes down in Edinburgh Botanics renovations
description: The 60ft tree is too big to be moved from a hot house in renovations at Edinburgh's Botanic Gardens.

title: Northamptonshire woman, 110, shares her secret to a long life
description: Joyce Wooding has received seven birthday cards from the Queen.

title: Music company buys NFT of 'Side-eyeing Chloe' meme

description: More than 500 gather for a vigil for the teacher who was killed as she walked to a London pub.

title: La Palma volcano: Visual guide to what happened
